review: While the Chromecast has its limitations, it still does a great job delivering in terms of what it is supposed to do. For its very reasonable price, I couldn't ask for more.If you have a TV without wireless internet capabilities and you want to stream Netflix and YouTube, etc. to your TV, this is probably the best value around. As long as you have an HDMI port on your TV, you will be able to use this. It even comes with a USB cord and a standard electrical outlet plug adapter if you need to power it that way. Not to mention it also comes with an HDMI extender to make sure that you don't have to worry about whether you have room to plug the Chromecast into your TV.I would certainly recommend this to anyone who feels they could benefit from the advertised features of the Chromecast. It delivers as promised.

review: The Chromecast is a nice device which is capable of doing exactly what it is advertised to do...nothing more. Unlike the Roku devices, you will need a PC/laptop/tablet or smartphone to stream movies. Once you have the movie streaming, you can even turn off the device you used to start the stream. For example, I initiated a stream on my phone and then turned off the phone. The movie continued streaming on the TV. The Chromecast is an excellent device for Google Play movies/music. I didn't try any of the other compatible services (Hulu, HBO, etc.) It is not compatible with Amazon videos as it is with Google Play BUT you can still stream an Amazon Movie from your laptop using the Google Chrome browser. What you'll see is your actual laptop's display being streamed. Doing that requires the laptop to remain on. You can pretty much stream anything in a Chrome browser tab as long as you have the Chromecast extension addon.For $35, it's a nice little device that does what it says it will do...very easy to setup.
